source_passages.text: “The few of us that were well outside sat and wept in hiding, and cursed Smaug; and there we were unexpectedly joined by my father and my grandfather with singed beards.
“I did not ‘get hold of it,’ I was given it,” said the wizard. “Your grandfather Thror was killed, you remember, in the mines of Moria by Azog the Goblin .”
“I did not ‘get hold of it,’ I was given it,” said the wizard. “Your grandfather Thror was killed, you remember, in the mines of Moria by Azog the Goblin .”
He was witless and wandering, and had forgotten almost everything except the map and the key.”

magic.title: He is an enemy far beyond the powers of all the dw...
magic.description: He is an enemy far beyond the powers of all the dwarves put together

source_passages.text: He is an enemy far beyond the powers of all the dwarves put together, if they could all be collected again from the four corners of the world.

technology.title: It was a dwarf with a blue beard tucked into a gol...
technology.description: It was a dwarf with a blue beard tucked into a golden belt

source_passages.text: It was a dwarf with a blue beard tucked into a golden belt, and very bright eyes under his dark-
It was two more dwarves, both with blue hoods, silver belts, and yellow beards; and each of them carried a bag of tools and a spade.
He had hardly turned the knob, before they were all inside, bowing and saying “at your service” one after another.

technology.title: It was a beautiful golden harp
technology.description: It was a beautiful golden harp

source_passages.text: It was a beautiful golden harp, and when Thorin struck it the music began all at once, so sudden and sweet that Bilbo forgot everything else, and was swept away into dark lands under strange moons, fa

technology.title: and many a song Was sung unheard by men or elves
technology.description: and many a song Was sung unheard by men or elves

source_passages.text: Goblets they carved there for themselves And harps of gold; where no man delves There lay they long, and many a song Was sung unheard by men or elves.

technology.title: Swords in these parts are mostly blunt
technology.description: Swords in these parts are mostly blunt

source_passages.text: Swords in these parts are mostly blunt, and axes are used for trees, and shields as cradles or dish-covers; and dragons are comfortably far-off (and therefore legendary).

technology.description: One thing he did make his mind up about was not to bother to get up very early and cook everybody else

source_passages.text: One thing he did make his mind up about was not to bother to get up very early and cook everybody else’s wretched breakfast.

Bilbo went to sleep with that in his ears, and it gave him very uncomfortable dreams.

source_passages.text: There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them to disappear quietly and quickly when large stupid folk like you and me come blundering along, making a noise
All that the unsuspecting Bilbo saw that morning was an old man with a staff.
Not the wandering wizard that gave Old Took a pair of magic diamond studs that fastened themselves and never came undone till ordered?
“Where else should I be?” said the wizard. “All the same I am pleased to find you remember something about me.
Wizards after all are wizards.
After a while he stepped up, and with the spike on his staff scratched a queer sign on the hobbit’s beautiful green front-door.
And there was Gandalf behind, leaning on his staff and laughing.
Then Gandalf’s smoke-ring would go green and come back to hover over the wizard’s head.
Far over the misty mountains cold To dungeons deep and caverns old We must away ere break of day To seek the pale enchanted gold.
The dwarves of yore made mighty spells, While hammers fell like ringing bells In places deep, where dark things sleep, In hollow halls beneath the fells.
